Bel Canto or May a Hooker Sob?
introduction: This stylized satire, inspired by Heinrich Mann’s novel ‘A World Reception’, sheds light on the ominous alliance of money and culture. An unsuccessful theatre manager tries to raise money for a new opera house (thereby also securing his own career) at a gala with personalities from the cultural and financial world. But he fails miserably. Cult performers such as Kurt Raab, Udo Kier, and Romy Haag, and the film’s expressive black-and-white images, exaggerated gestures, and a cappella singing, offer viewers an unusual cinematic experience.
